ray.rage.rendersystem.states

Interface FrontFaceState

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, RenderState
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL4FrontFaceState

    public interface FrontFaceState
extends RenderState
    A front-face state determines which side, or "face", of a primitive should be drawn.

    Culling back faces avoid wasting GPU cycles in trying to render surfaces that are invisible because they're facing away from the camera.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  FrontFaceState.VertexWinding
      Specifies the vertex or index sequence pattern to use to determine what the "front" and "back" faces of a renderable are.
